info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 4:28AM CST until January 01 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow with total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible. Locally higher amounts possible. Blowing and drifting snow is also expected, creating reduced visibilities with wind gusts up to 25 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Prepare for snowpacked road conditions along with cold wind chills as low as 20 degrees below zero. Wind chills of this magnitude could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If traveling for the New Year continue to check back frequently for the latest forecast regarding this winter storm as it is still a couple days away and some changes to the forecast are possible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
